posts.post_content:
for nothing, theres a 'tap for mana' ability... very very useful, and diversification of the mana sources is always useful..   
for example, if your opponent springs a armageddon/limited resources/balance or whatever, moxes dont count under them!

Posted By: spoonish (9/20/2009 2:23:24 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: It's all about having access to more mana than your opponent earlier. Imagine getting two Moxs in hand - by turn two, you have access to 4 mana (more if you have Llanowar elves or Birds of Paradise). Sure, Black Lotus is better, but if your deck can't win on turn two, having the stability to constantly draw more mana per turn than your opponent helps more in games.
posts.html:

Posted By: TheSwarm (2/3/2011 4:15:23 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Better than normal lands, superior over artifact lands.
  
TBH, I don't see the Moxes as being great, but who wants to pass on a better card that can substitute for a land (but is better because being able to play another "land" is well worth the artifact weakness that is situational. And can even be an advantage in certain decks)?

Posted By: land_comment (3/26/2011 6:17:36 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Moxes are power people, I've used them all, even before the restricting rules came out. Why are the moxes powerful? well on their own each mox is a boost for speed mana, which is powerful (not broken) what makes them broken is using all 5 in the same deck, plus those newer ones Diamond, Opal and the Chrome.
  
   
it's like playing 4 lightning bolts, you draw 1 and bolt the guy he's at 17 (still alot of life) you play another from your opening hand he's at 14, the more bolts the more effective the resault. The same goes for Moxes, when your opening hand is..
  
   
Mox Emerald, Any land, Mox Diamond, any other land, Wheel of Fortune, (and 2 whatever cards, could be counterspell and Force of Will)
  
   
you drop a land, drop the Emerald, drop the Diamond and ditch a land, tap them play Wheel
  
   
You just hosed your opponent, they discard 7 and you both draw 7 new cards. At this point you've only played 2 moxes out of 8 (1 copy of each in the deck plus a Lotus) what are your chances of drawing mor... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

it's like playing 4 lightning bolts, you draw 1 and bolt the guy he's at 17 (still alot of life) you play another from your opening hand he's at 14, the more bolts the more effective the resault. The same goes for Moxes, when your opening hand is..

Mox Emerald, Any land, Mox Diamond, any other land, Wheel of Fortune, (and 2 whatever cards, could be counterspell and Force of Will)

you drop a land, drop the Emerald, drop the Diamond and ditch a land, tap them play Wheel

You just hosed your opponent, they discard 7 and you both draw 7 new cards. At this point you've only played 2 moxes out of 8 (1 copy of each in the deck plus a Lotus) what are your chances of drawing mor... (see all)
